messageBody:
Hi Guys,

I'm just wondering. Have the JUnit developers considered adding dependency annotations to JUnit? You could annotate your code with say

"@TestDependency Test1 public void myTest() {code;}", which would cause myTest() to depend on Test1 running it's tests first.

A scenario where this might be needed...
1. Test1 inserts DB records
2. Nightly job runs (but can be run manually by user)
3. Test2.myTest() then runs, as #2 has completed, and myTest() now has data that can be used.

In the case of #2, it would need to give the user enough time to run the nightly job, manually.

I'm wanting to test everything in a totally automated way. But at this point, it is not entirely possible.

I just wanted to ask about this, as you guys probably have a lot more experience in why this is or is not a good idea.

Thanks.
